name: Bagna Cauda
author: Julie P.
summary: Ever since a family friend introduced us to this Italian dip, we have made it a tradition on New Year's Eve. You have to really like garlic to enjoy this. I have heard that some people omit the cream and substitute olive oil also. Serve with crusty Italian bread, raw cabbage wedges, lettuce, bread sticks or crackers.
directions: Melt butter in a medium saucepan over medium heat
Stir in garlic and cook until tender
Mix in anchovy filets and heavy cream
Remove from heat, cover and chill in the refrigerator approximately 2 hours
Return the mixture to medium heat, stirring occasionally, until bubbly
